title: How I Installed Ubuntu Dual Boot with Windows
excerpt: Setting up Ubuntu alongside Windows was an exciting journey into the world of Linux. Here's my step-by-step experience and the essential commands I learned along the way.

sections.heading: Preparation Steps
sections.text: Before installing Ubuntu, I backed up all my important data and created a bootable USB drive using Rufus. I also freed up around 50GB of space on my hard drive by shrinking my Windows partition using Disk Management.

sections.heading: Installation Process
sections.text: I disabled Fast Startup in Windows and Secure Boot in BIOS settings. Then I booted from the USB drive and followed the Ubuntu installer, choosing "Install Ubuntu alongside Windows" option. The installer automatically handled the partitioning.

sections.heading: Post-Installation Tips
sections.text: After installation, I updated all packages, installed essential software like Chrome and VS Code, and customized the desktop environment. The dual boot setup works flawlessly, and I can easily switch between Windows and Ubuntu using the GRUB bootloader.
This setup has significantly improved my development workflow and introduced me to the powerful world of Linux command line tools.
